citations.narrative:
The bottom bag of a stack of dog food has about a inch diameter hole chewed into the side and there are spilled pieces of
kibble and rodent feces on the palate in the immediate area around the hole. The hole is round and has ragged edges
indicating rodents likely chewed it open.
Mice and other vermin can carry diseases and their fecal material is a source of bacteria that can contaminate food.
Food must be stored in a manner that protects it from spoilage, contamination, and vermin infestation.
To be corrected by: November 7, 2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
3.1(e) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
The bottom bag of a stack of dog food has about a inch diameter hole chewed into the side and there are spilled pieces of 
kibble and rodent feces on the palate in the immediate area around the hole. The hole is round and has ragged edges 
indicating rodents likely chewed it open. 
Mice and other vermin can carry diseases and their fecal material is a source of bacteria that can contaminate food. 
Food must be stored in a manner that protects it from spoilage, contamination, and vermin infestation. 
To be corrected by: November 7, 2023 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
